entry.title: Coq
entry.keywords: formal verifification methods theorem proving gallina ltac
entry.body:
Level: Professional
Summary: Used to formally verify algorithms developed for SiFIve, contributed to the Coq Standard Library, and released packages on the Coq Package Index.

entry.title: RISC-V
entry.keywords: hardware computer processor assembly formal verifification methods theorem proving
entry.body:
Level: Professional
Summary: Developed Kami Processor, an open source RISC-V processor. Formalized the RISC-V specification. Thoroughly knowledgable about the RISC-V specification.

entry.title: Drupal
entry.keywords: web development drupal cms content management system
entry.body:
Level: Professional
Summary: Over 10 years of professional experience developing Drupal websites and modules. I have developed websites using Drupal 6, 7, and 8, for a variety of clients including Johns Hopkins University.

entry.title: Gallina and Ltac
entry.keywords: coq formal verification methods theorem proving agda isabelle hol programming language
entry.body:
Level: Fluent
Summary: Used to formally verify algorithms developed for SiFIve, contributed to the Coq Standard Library, and released packages on the Coq Package Index.

entry.title: Haskell
entry.keywords: functional lazy programming language
entry.body:
Level: Fluent
Summary: Used to model peripheral devices while developing the Kami Processor at SiFive. I have experience debugging, profiling, and optimizing Haskell programs using GHC's analysis toolchain.

entry.title: JavaScript
entry.keywords: web nodejs node programming language
entry.body:
Level: Fluent
Summary: Developed a JavaScript framework similar to REACT-JS. Professional experience developing NodeJS based applications, and integrating REACT-JS with Drupal's theme system.

entry.title: Solidity
entry.keywords: blockchain block chain crypto programming language
entry.body:
Level: Familiar
Summary: Have Read the Solidity language specification.

Summary: Extensive professional experience using Sass

entry.title: PHP
entry.keywords: web html xml css drupal php programming language
entry.body:
Level: Fluent
Summary: Over 10 years of experience developing Drupal based websites and modules. Drupal's back-end is written in PHP.

entry.title: Scheme
entry.keywords: functional lisp clojure programming language
entry.body:
Level: Familiar
Summary: Have read the R6RS and R7RS specifications and used Scheme on several informal projects.

entry.title: OCaml
entry.keywords: functional programming language
entry.body:
Level: Familiar
Summary: Coursework included the ML variant SML. I am familiar with OCaml primarily through my interactions with Coq, which is written in OCaml. Additionally, I have read the OCaml language Specification.

entry.title: SiFive
entry.keywords: work history employer company companies
entry.body:
Years: 2018 - 2020
Position: Sr. Engineer
Summary: Developed an open source RISC-V processor, used Coq to formally verify components used within SiFive's S-series processors, and contributed to the developement of Kami, a hardware modeling language embedded within Coq.

entry.title: Elucid Solutions
entry.keywords: work history employer company companies
entry.body:
Years: 2015 - 2018
Position: Sr. Programmer Analyst
Summary: Developed several websites using Drupal for several government agencies. Attained the highest Contractor Performance Assessment Reporting System (CPARS) rating, including "exceptional" ratings for "quality," "schedule," and "management," for my work developing achp.gov. Was instrumental in helping Elucid Solutions attain a CMMI (v1.3) level 3 certification.

entry.title: Johns Hopkins Univeristy
entry.keywords: work history employer company companies
entry.body:
Years: 2015 - 2009
Position: Sr. Programmer Analyst
Summary: Drupal developer for several high profile websites including Popline, the largest online database of scientific research articles concerning reproductive health; and mHealth Evidence, an online database of scholarly journal articles related to mobile health interventions.
